attributes.action: Change Use Class C3 wording to prevent LTD Company abuse of “Lawful Development”
attributes.background: Planning regs. Use Class C3 wording should be changed to “up to six people living together as a single household and receiving care from non-residential carers” to stop multimillion £ Ltd Companies using private residential houses as care homes without requiring planning permission for change of use
attributes.additional_details:
Councils are consistently concluding that a change of use DOES occur.  

Some are rejecting applications and some are issuing certificates on the basis that the change does not constitute a MATERIAL change in use in PLANNING TERMS.

Application DA/2015/0762 in Daventry District Council and SL/2016/0608 South Lakeland District Council were both submitted by the same company with a multi-million £ turnover citing the same evidence.  One rejected, the other permitted. 

Two of many inconsistencies.

attributes.action: Mandatory for all employers to offer a phased return to work for new parents
attributes.background: Offering working parents a phased return to work will help to provide a smoother transition back to work. Providing the stay at home parent with an enhanced support system and allowing the working parent more time to form a positive relationship without as much of a financial burden.

attributes.action: LOWER THE AGE OF FREE CHILD CARE FROM 3 TO 2 TO SUPPORT WORKING FAMILIES
attributes.background: In the UK, childcare is provided for working families at the age of 3 which means that from a young age, working families need to pay up to £40 a day for childcare. For full timers this equates to £800 per month. More than the average mortgage payment.
attributes.additional_details: For non working families childcare is provided for free of charge. This is a backwards system as why would someone who doesn't work need their child watched full time. Where as some one who is working has to pay for their child care and receives no support.

attributes.action: Include School Transport to salary sacrifice schemes to enable tax/NI savings
attributes.background: Many working parents are facing high costs for self funding school transport. For some families this can be £1000s each year. We would like school transport vouchers to be included in the government salary sacrifice schemes in the same way that childcare vouchers and cycle to work schemes are.
attributes.additional_details: The government currently funds school transport for children attending their nearest school, for many families the nearest school is not the best option so they choose to self-fund transport and send their child to another school. For parents making this decision they are generating £1000s in cost savings to local councils as the council no longer has the financial obligation to provide transport. We ask the government to support working families with this simple change.

attributes.action: Condemn the disgraceful and dangerous actions of Donald Trump
attributes.background:
Cancelling affordable healthcare for people with long term conditions, possibly at risk of their lives.
Denying entry to the US to people with a legal right to be there. 
Removing federal funding from any organisation that offers abortion advice - even for victims of rape.

And much more
attributes.additional_details:
Also

Condoning sexual misconduct.
Presenting ‘alternative facts’ or ‘lies’ as the rest of us call them.
Removing federal funding from any organisation that offers abortion advice - even for victims of rape.
Ordering the removal of climate change information from government web sites.

And probably more, news is breaking faster than I can type.

http://www.newstatesman.com/world/2017/01/here-are-23-terrifying-things-president-trump-has-done-last-seven-days

attributes.action: Right to buy from housing association with full discount make housing accessible
attributes.background:
We have Right to buy which provides you discount if you have lived in council property for over 3 years. 

We can get up to 50% discount of property 

Like if you lived in council property for 15 years you are eligible for 45% Discount 

£150000 * 45 / 100 = 67,500 you pay only £82,500
attributes.additional_details:
https://righttobuy.gov.uk/right-to-buy-calculator/

https://www.gov.uk/right-to-acquire-buying-housing-association-home/overview

We would like the government to provide the same discount for Right to Acquire as Right to Buy. This will help lot of people to get on property ladder and easily accessible especially for younger generation as they are eligible if they have lived in the household. With rise in rent and housing prices this would be best option for lower to middle class to become owners

attributes.action: Affordable Clear Citizenship Path for all who earned Permanent Leave to Remain.
attributes.background: This is vital in the context of Brexit as it would remove the threat of unjust deportation from many long term resident from the EU and is recommended in report by the All-Party Parliamentary Group (APPG) on Social Integration Integration http://www.socialintegrationappg.org.uk/reports
attributes.additional_details:
The report by the All-Party Parliamentary Group (APPG) on Social Integration recommends "reducing the naturalisation
fees, which have recently spiralled to just under £1,200—almost ten times the cost to the Home Office of processing the application, and over six times more than the cost in countries such as Germany and Canada" and providing a clear guided path to citizenship for all long term residents from other countries including those from other EU countries.

attributes.action: Allow our FIREFIGHTERS to use seized & impounded vehicles for training purposes.
attributes.background: FIREFIGHTERS have to purchase scrap vehicles in order to train in essential skills such as roof & door removal, car fires & people extraction so that WE can be saved in emergency situations. WHY are we crushing vehicles seized at the roadside when we could GIVE these to the FIRE FIGHTERS!? Help NOW!
attributes.additional_details: Firefighters have to buy scrap vehicles from their own budgets at times when front line services are being cut and cars, seized at the roadside by the Police are being crushed into cubes when they could be used in training. Purchased vehicles are used VERY sparingly in order to extend training as they cannot afford to buy them when seized cars are being cubed daily. These skills that require practice save lives - please sign this petition as it could be your life saved by your signature one day!

attributes.action: Youths 14-18 required to be CRB checked if working at a youth organisation
attributes.background: Children at youth organisations in the UK are being put at risk as there is no current guidelines or law allowing a youth worker/leader to check on the Sex offenders register about a person who is under 18.
attributes.additional_details: The law needs to change to allow a youth who will be mixing with children to be checked against the register, as under 18 no CRB checks are ever made and this is dangerous.

attributes.action: Provide free accommodation for ex-service personnel
attributes.background: As Veterans have served our country and risked their lives, why should they be left out in the cold with no food or water. All Veterans should be given accommodation after leaving the Forces until they are able to support themselves again.

attributes.action: That the Government delay triggering Article 50 until 23rd June, 2031.
attributes.background: That the Government delay triggering Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union until 23rd June, 2031, that is a period of 15 years from the referendum date. This delay is to enable the economy to stabilise and allow proper preparations to be put in place for the separation from the European Union.

attributes.action: Create a single Bullying Law that applies to all Schools in England
attributes.background: Schools are letting pupils down by not taking Bullying seriously and ignoring their policies. There needs to be a Law on Bullying that all Schools have to abide by. There are Children taking their own lives and i feel this would stop if there was a law that made schools help.
attributes.additional_details: News Articles. My own experience with my Child. I have spoken to numerous other Parents about their experiences too

attributes.action: Change abortion laws. Abortions should only be up until week 15 no later.
attributes.background: U.K Abortion laws should be reduced to 15 weeks unless a threat to the baby or mothers health. This gives women plenty of time to make up their mind about their choice. Provide more sexual health education instead and provide free contraception to schools and GPs.
attributes.additional_details: Some babies have survived abortions and some babies have been born premature and have survived from as early as week 20 yet our law permits abortion til week 24. Provide better support for women in sexual relations instead with better sexual health education, free contraception and guidance counselling or some sort of help with personal development and relationships. Encourage adoption instead. Fund better antenatal support. Give free counselling support to victims of rape instead.

attributes.action: Please don't wage another war in the ME after Iraq,Libya,Afghanistan now Syria!
attributes.background: Please send no troops, SAS special forces and clandestine operations into Syria. Unless Syria declares war on us, we shell stay neutral and not get involved in this war. We have our own country to care for. And we caused enough suffering and damage to the Middle East already. Please save the peace!
attributes.additional_details: The war on Iraq was based on a lie. The war on Libya caused death and suffering to the Libyan Nation and extreme damage to the security of Europe and the whole world. Yemen was bombed for many years by drones now by Saudis. Afghanistan is turning back into a unsafe war torn country under the rule of Taliban. Please save Syria and stay out of it. Let the Syrian Government and their Allies deal with their problem. Its not our Country. Not our war. We have a beautiful country to care for!

attributes.action: Require transport authorities to fund free concessionary fares for unpaid carers
attributes.background: Unpaid Carers (carers who do not provide care as a career) are a crucial part of society saving the government £162 billion every year. Travel is an essential service and yet, is a barrier that makes it harder for us to deal with our many responsibilities.
attributes.additional_details: Public transport is a service that is a need, we are an essential part of the community so why can't we use it too! Not everyone can get benefits so let's help carers get what they deserve, it may not seem important to most but to many it will change their lives. We deserve to be treated as equals...Is free/concessionary transport for carers to much to ask for in return for those who dedicate their lives to care for others?

attributes.action: Make it law that all bus companies must have space for 2 wheelchairs and a Pram
attributes.background:
Were asking that we catch up with mainland europe when it comes to disability access especially on transport such as buses who currently only allow one wheelchair and a pram.

Disabled people travel together and to expect them to catch separate buses so they can go out together is disgraceful!
attributes.additional_details:
Its time we caught up with mainland europes public transport giving a minimum of 2 priority wheelchair spaces on each bus and a space for 1 or 2 prams.

Wheelchair users find it hard to use public transport but if your a wheelchair user with another friend whos a wheelchair user you find it impossible to go out together as you have to take separate buses some which could be an hour apart.

Its time the companies providing the service were made to make this a requirement making it fairer for all

attributes.action: Fund Health visitors & Midwifes to do the UNICEF babyfriendly initative training
attributes.background: We need atleast 50% of Health visitors & Midwifes to funded to do the UNICEF babyfriendly initative training. Not doing so means that Health Visitors and Midwives do not have enough training to give correct advice regarding baby health and breast feeding, and cannot follow current NICE guidelines.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.unicef.org.uk/babyfriendly/
http://www.unicef.org.uk/BabyFriendly/Health-Professionals/
https://www.nice.org.uk/sharedlearning/implementing-and-evaluating-training-for-health-visiting-teams-as-part-of-the-unicef-uk-baby-friendly-initiative-community-award
https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg37/chapter/1-Recommendations#maternal-health

attributes.action: Put cameras on Humber Bridge to catch speeders, tailgaters & poor drivers
attributes.background: The bridge is often closed for hours on end because theres been an accident caused by someones poor driving. The speed limit is 50, but drivers often go upwards of 60. The drivers are inches away from other car bumpers, trying to intimidate the other cars into going faster than the 50 limit
attributes.additional_details: There are cameras at the booths. These have witnessed road rage incidents, & drivers going through the tag lane above 50 (the limit at the booths is 30)

attributes.action: Stop the proposed closure of wards at Cheadle, Staffordshire, hospital.
attributes.background: The closure of wards will result in local residents having to travel long distances to other hospitals - mainly to the Royal Stoke hospital which is already under extreme pressure from the sheer volume of patients.
attributes.additional_details: Royal Stoke hospital lacks parking for visitors - Cheadle is well provided for parking spaces. It is also well run and well liked by local residents.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage to 8 pounds per hour
attributes.background: The minimum wage is 7.20 an hour for over 25 year old this is a joke...company directors share holders and the rich are getting ever richer off the backs of the poor it's shamefull that in this country the top 1 percent have over 90 percent of the wealth..

attributes.action: Stop the need for people with permanent disabilities to renew their Blue Badges
attributes.background: Currently everyone in need of a blue badge has to renew it every 3 years. In some cases where the situation is temporary this is fine. For most though their situations are not going to change. It is unnecessary for us to renew.

attributes.action: British & European Citizenship for those who wish to remain a part of Europe.
attributes.background: Given that there is precedent for dual nationality in N.Ireland I feel it is only fair, and morally right, that as just under half of the country didn't want to leave the EU that those who wish to stay should have the option to keep European citizenship when Brexit negotiations begin.
attributes.additional_details:
I was born in N.Ireland and as I grew up I was told I was N.Irish, Irish, British and European. I had a choice on who I affiliated myself with and I had a choice to be a part of something smaller, or something bigger; I chose the latter.

It is therefore, with precedent and just under half the country having voted to remain, that the government should not ignore what is a large minority and give everyone the rights that others in these islands already have.

Choice on citizenship!

attributes.action: Open an inquiry into Atos/Maximus and the work capability assessment
attributes.background: There should be an independent inquiry into the work capability assessments carried out by ATOS and MAXIMUS. We need to know more about the terms of the contracts to know whether they are selling our data. We need to know how many people have died because of their actions.
attributes.additional_details: The “health care professionals” employed by these companies, who work directly for the DWP, should listen to the consultants. They say that seriously ill people are fit for work, and some have died within the space of a year. These contracted companies are paid £1.6 billion. These are foreign companies who get rich off the British taxpayer. There is no concern for Disabled persons in the UK.

attributes.action: Make toll roads free for HGV's
attributes.background: With rising costs associated with running haulage companies including fuel, road tax, operator licence fees e.t.c toll roads are a cost that should be wavered for HGV. A prime example being the M6 toll. Allowing HGV'S to use this for free would have a massively positive impact on congestion.

attributes.action: Open Drug Crisis Centres. stop death and crime with compassion and help.
attributes.background: It is a fact the war on drugs is not working. People are dying without help or a chance to get help.  Glasgow has just  opened its doors on a Drug crisis centre. It helps people to handle and control their substance abuse, offers help guidance and rehabilitation to those who would like to get better
attributes.additional_details: If you want to know more about how drug prohibition does not work. A good book is Chasing the Scream or Neil Woods, book Good cop, Bad war. It does not matter how much we spend trying to stop use of drugs it does not ease the problem it just makes it worse. Canada had a massive drug problem until they opened up safe centres for people to use and to get help. Portugal have stopped making drugs illegal and again the problems are being tackled, less death and crime. More Compassion4Progression

attributes.action: Make equal rights the heart of any trade deal with America.
attributes.background: Soon we will begin discussions with America on a trade deal; we should ensure that equal worker rights based on gender, sexuality, religion and race will be enshrined in this deal.
attributes.additional_details: Britain has always had a special relationship with America. This relationship has been forged as two nations who have fought side by side to defend the rights of the individual. Brexit has given us an opportunity to create our own trade deals with nations. We should use these trade deals to cement the shared values we hold dear.

attributes.action: Include women in the national screening programme for abdominal aortic aneurysms
attributes.background: Public Health England run a national screening programme for men aged ≥65 to detect abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA). If left undetected, a AAA rupture is fatal in 90% of cases. The condition is not unique to men, women also suffer and die from AAA ruptures. So why aren't women also screened?
attributes.additional_details:
Screening is a way of detecting an aneurysm early. If the abdominal aortic artery gets particularly swollen, you might feel a pulsating feeling or pain in your stomach or back pain. If you don't experience this, you won’t know you have an aneurysm until it bursts, when it becomes an emergency and is usually fatal.
Ruptured AAAs are less common in women and, on average, occur 10 years later than in men.So why is there not a screening programme for women aged 75 or above? Women are equal!

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading for all High Street Retailers
attributes.background: We lost something valuable as a country when Sunday became a normal shopping day rather than a day for family, rest and relaxation. The freedom of some to shop on Sundays comes at the expense of those who have to work to serve them when they might want to spend time with their families

attributes.action: Add Euro Indexation to the State Pension triple-lock
attributes.background: Since the Brexit vote on 23 June, the value of the pound has been falling. Those on private pensions have seen a surge in value as international companies and world markets prosper. Average earnings and the consumer price index will remain muted, leading to a fall in the value of the State Pension.
attributes.additional_details: On 23 June, the pound was worth 1.30169 Euro (ref. OANDA) - by the end of the year it had lost more than 10% of its value. This trend is likely to continue. By November, the CPI was only 1.2% (ref. ONS). - The Pensions Committee is thinking of scrapping the triple-lock, but we suggest replacing "or 2.5%" with "or 1.30169/FX" where FX is the value of the Pound in terms of the Euro.

attributes.action: Compulsory for UK schools to teach about sexual consent.
attributes.background: In the UK, it's not compulsory for schools to teach anything about sexual consent or healthy relationships, only about the biology of sex. Before teenagers are sexually active, consent education will give them the power to recognise when receiving or inflicting abuse/exploitation/rape.
attributes.additional_details: On average, the age of first intercourse experience is 15.6 years (14.9 for men and 15.9 for women). It seems, the majority of teenagers are sexually active before the legal age. It is for this reason, sexual consent must be taught before the age of 16. Not just our daughters should leave school able to navigate the sexual challenges and choices they’ll face in adulthood but more importantly boys. Schools must become educators and advocates of sex-positivity/healthy consent for both genders.

attributes.action: Apply to rejoin EFTA & retain EEA membership as objective of Art 50 negotiations
attributes.background: We call on HMG to aim for a practical workable realistic outcome in negotiations with the EU. To that end, rejoining EFTA & remaining in the EEA is the only sensible initial route. Any other approach will waste time, to the detriment of us all.

attributes.action: Legalise the pharmaceutical production of THC for medicinal purposes.
attributes.background: Across the world THC has been proven to benefit a massive range of medical issues, from Anxiety disorders to Parkinson's disease. It is a neuropathic relaxant and can give those in need more control therefore enhancing their wellbeing, independence and reduces the use of other treatments.
attributes.additional_details:
The argument against this is the fear of drug abuse - which is already unregulated and rife. Unlike alcohol and tobacco; there is no evidence of overdose, violence or suicide under the influence of THC. It's neuropathic relaxants enhance endorphins.
In legalising the pharmaceutical production, companies can create a medicated and prescribable form of THC which can be monitored and managed by clinicians.
Presently, there are no controls and those in medical need suffer in desperation.

attributes.action: Allow children access to more speech therapy on the NHS.
attributes.background: I want the NHS to offer more speech therapy on the NHS.  I have been fighting to get my son help for 2 years. We have to pay privately for someone to listen to us. We are seen weekly privately, but the NHS won't offer anywhere close to this. Our son has made so much progress having weekly sessions.

attributes.action: Make the HPV vaccine programme aimed towards both sexes instead of only females.
attributes.background: The HPV vaccine (the 'jab' females are highly recommended to get before sexual activity) is not only necessary for females but males as well to help prevent anal, throat and penile cancers, as well as over 100 types of HPV diseases.
attributes.additional_details: Males are not encouraged to receive this vaccine before sexual activity based on the logic that if females don't have the HPV infections then males won't receive them through sexual contact. This leaves males who have sex with males vulnerable to the infections as well as ignoring the benefits the injection has to prevent multiple cancers. The NHS has been encouraging this change for years yet no action has been taken, leaving males uneducated in the matter and at risk of major health hazards.

attributes.action: Evacuate Aleppo with joint UN task force, giving refuge in Britain to citizens.
attributes.background: The city of Aleppo has been conquered by the dictator Assad. His forces are massacring its people - men, women and children. It is preventable. Ask the government to petition a UN/EU task force to immediately go into the city as peacekeepers, not to directly fight Assad, but to evacuate citizens.
attributes.additional_details: All over twitter, Aleppo refugees are posting how the government is murdering them en masse. Innocent men, women and children. The UN must condemn the massacre as against international law, and the UN, failing them the EU, failing that Britain alone, mut notify Assad of its intent, and send a task force to the city. Not to fight Assad's forces directly, but to advise his troops to not engage, & to protect any citizen fleeing the city against his troops, withdrawing when the people are removed.

attributes.action: A  Vote of No Confidence in the Transport Secretary re Southern Railways dispute
attributes.background: The Transport Secretary has made it clear  he has no interest in the Southern/RMT/ASLEF rail dispute. People have lost their jobs, been refused job interviews & in some cases missed hospital appointments. His lack of action is grossly negligent and he should no longer be a government minister.

attributes.action: Make cyber bullying/online threats to be recognised as a serious crime.
attributes.background: There are too many people these days taking their own life due to online threats, bullying etc. If you have ever been to the police about online threats they generally will tell you they cannot help and this needs to stop. It needs to be investigated properly, this will lead to lives being saved.
attributes.additional_details:
Online bullying/threats have become a major problem as technology advances, so how many more people need to take their lives before anything changes?

Some facts in the UK about cyber bullying:
There were over 11,000 counselling sessions with young people who talked to Childline about online issues last year
More than 16,000 young people are absent from school due to bullying.
20% of people who experience cyber bullying contemplate suicide, 1 in 10 attempt it.

attributes.action: Reinstate pension age of 65 men 60 women for British citizens above 50 years old
attributes.background: Government greatly reduced the level of state pension paid with recent reform. This asks Government to reverse that decision for all people over the age of 50 years who have made a major contribution to their own state pension only to see it stolen away in the last years of their working lives.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for companies to label their environmental impact on packaging
attributes.background: The same way we have warnings on packs of cigarettes, we need to inform consumers on the negative effects some of their purchase have on the planet. As a start, we request "Palm Oil Kills" warnings (text & picture) covering 13% of front & back of packaging for products using unsustainable palm oil.
attributes.additional_details: A large proportion of palm oil plantations are developed at the expense of biodiversity and ecosystems in the countries it is produced. Currently, a third of all mammal species in Indonesia are considered to be critically endangered as a consequence. Over 90% of orangutan habitat has been destroyed in the last 20 years and is considered “a conservation emergency” by the UN. An estimated 1000-5000 orangutans are killed each year for this development. More information can be found online.

attributes.action: Require all universities by law to consider applications anonymously.
attributes.background: Recent studies have shown that perfectly able candidates are not being offered the same opportunities due to 'name discrimination'. This can be in the form of prejudice surrounding names related to ethnic origin or even gender discrimination within big companies that would like more male employees.
attributes.additional_details:
-Dr. Colin Holbrook, a research scientist at the UCLA Center for Behavior, Evolution, and Culture has recently done a study showing that names have an influence on job interviews and university places in terms of race and gender.
-By making it law for organisations such as UCAS to require anonymous applications it will hopefully prevent discrimination against those with ethnic-sounding or just clear gender identifiable names, based on stereotypes.

attributes.action: Ban drinking alcohol in Parliament by MP's
attributes.background: Alcohol at work is not allowed as it is unsafe and people can make decisions that when they were sober they may consider what they did was inappropriate.  So why when the interest of the UK is being debated and voted on by MP's are they allowed to be under the influence of alcohol.

attributes.action: Abandon plans to force companies to 'list foreign workers'
attributes.background: The Government has announced that it wants to force companies in the UK to list how many foreign workers they employ, with the purpose being to 'name and shame' employers who do not employ enough British workers. This highly Xenophobic policy is demeans the country we live in and should be withdrawn
attributes.additional_details:
Immigrants are human beings and they do not deserve to be treated unequally. If the government presses forwards with this policy it will open the door to yet more hatred and division in British society, and push us close to the kinds of policies widespread in Europe in the 1930s

-- 

Quote in the Petition title taken from the Times front page, 05/10/16

attributes.action: All products with gelatine must be labelled clearly,animal or vegetable gelatine
attributes.background: There are many products on the market which contain gelatine. Gelatine is found in our foods, sweets and in our pharmaceutical products,these are just a few examples. Clear labelling on EVERY product that contains gelatine and what type of gelatine it is, be it from animals or vegetables.

attributes.action: Make sexism a hate crime across the UK and in all institutions
attributes.background: Sexism is not yet legally a hate crime which is making court cases difficult due to no specific law dictating what counts as sexist abuse. Nottingham is already attempting to make it a hate crime but this will not be effective until it is on a big scale.

attributes.action: Make it law that all ice rinks make you wear crash helmets and elbow protection.
attributes.background:
As a child growing up going ice skating i never wore crash helmets or elbow protection. 
As a adult taking my own children I have not made them either wear protection whilst Ice Skating, but when they go doughnutting they do wear crash helmets Recently i suffered a head injury ice skating.
attributes.additional_details:
I fell smashed my head on the Ice and have been suffering server concussion for 3 weeks and still recovering,So the last 3 weeks my 4 children , grandma and my husband all have to look after me as I have not been able to do anything . 

Please read about concussion and sign the petition keep all our children and parents safe . Thank you for your time

attributes.action: Increased protection for beneficiaries under Mirror Wills following first death.
attributes.background: My father and stepmother prepared Mirror Wills whereby the estate first passed to the surviving spouse and then to my stepbrother and myself in equal shares.  After my father died my stepmother changed her Will and left everything to her own family.  I lost my family inheritance of approx £150,000
attributes.additional_details:
I would like the following changes. (1)  A  formal warning to be included in all Mirror Wills that your final wishes may not be respected should you die first.  (2) A new legal requirement than any beneficiary under a Mirror Will  subsequently disinherited must receive formal written notice for it to have effect.
My story has been featured in the National Press, television and radio and is included in the current  television series of the BBC production "Rip Off Britain"

attributes.action: Create a new law for theft/damage of public access Life saving Equipment
attributes.background: Equipment such as Defibrillators or any lifesaving equipment. At present the law seems to be that they are only covered under simple theft act. We are now seeing more defibrillators in public; some that have been supplied by community fundraising/private donations surely they need more protection?
attributes.additional_details: A recent case; Hinckley where a man stole a defibrillator from a public box whilst a 1 man paramedic was attending to a incident, He has been arrested for theft, there have been other cases around the country. As a first aider & a volunteer responder I feel that a new law with a substantial minimum fine &/Or a prison term for theft/Damage of lifesaving equipment is needed. More public units are available & need to be protected. Potentially someone could die if the equipment is damaged or stolen.

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Examine the practicalities of introducing a ringfenced tax to help fund the NHS.
attributes.background:
The truth is that the UK is falling further behind other European countries in how much is spent on health. It is time to examine a dedicated ringfenced health and care tax.

The Treasury has estimated that a 1p rise in income tax would raise £3.9bn this year, rising to £4.5bn the year after.
attributes.additional_details:
Linking tax income with health and care spending would give people the opportunity to see how their money is being spent, and allow a legitimate debate about what is an appropriate level of taxation required to ensure a sustainable funding settlement for the NHS and social care system in the years to come. 

The Treasury has estimated that a 1p rise in income tax would raise £3.9bn this year, rising to £4.5bn next year and then £4.6bn in 2018-19. Without major reforms to how care is provided, the NHS in England is facing a £22bn gap in its finances by 2020-21.

attributes.action: No child maintenance for parents refusing access without legal reason to.
attributes.background: Parents who refuse access for other parent should not be entitled to any maintenance for that child if they cannot provide legal reasons and evidence for why they are refusing access. All attempts should be made by all parties involved to resolve outside the courts whenever possible.
attributes.additional_details: The relationship I was in dissolved when my then partner fell pregnant when I was in German with the Army, so I applied for early posting back to the UK and was posted to the south but my partner lived up north, I could only afford to travel once or twice a month, my partner said it wasn't good enough. I made journeys to see my child and on arrival was refused access which left me struggling financially,  Travel £240 a month maintenance £250 wasn't feasible. I live north now and still no access.
